paper_abstract: Converting a quadrilateral input mesh into a C-1 surface with one bi-3 tensor-product spline patch per facet is a classical challenge. We give explicit local averaging formulas for the spline control points. Where the quadrilateral mesh is not regular, the patches have two internal double knots, the least number and multiplicity to always allow for an unbiased G(1) construction. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Smooth Bi-3 spline surfaces with fewest knots
